website_summaries.verdict: Most of the reviews of the Asics GT 2000 6 were on the optimistic side. Commenters have talked about how comfortable and supportive the shoe was, and some also praised its quality. Criticisms, on the other hand, surround the sizing and few structural elements. Although very little was said about the shoe’s performance and reliability, the GT 2000 6 has still struck a positive note with its consumers.
pros: One runner was surprised that the GT 2000 6 did not require a break-in period
The shoe helped relieve hip and back pains, wrote a buyer
Whether sitting, standing, or running, the shoe provided an adequate amount of support, according to a reviewer
The shoe promoted forefoot balance successfully, a satisfied user stated
Several customers were pleased that the GT 2000 6 was more comfortable than the series’ earlier models
A commenter mentioned that they found the shoe to be durable
cons: Some users have said the sizing was too narrow
The sides of the tongue were too stiff, which felt uncomfortable when the shoe is worn without a sock, a wearer noted

customer_reviews.title: Good trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: A good “hybrid” trail show. The tread and weight seem less rugged than other trail shoes- I took them for their first outing and the performed well on the trail. I run in GT-2000 road shoes exclusively and these were spot on for off-road. After running a Ragnar trail race, I’ve gone to 4 stars. Shoes did fairly well is rough, muddy, wet conditions. Good amount of cushion, but they are far from water proof or resistant. Having a layer added to keep feet dry would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: d. gibson

customer_reviews.title: Fit well - seem to to be well made too
customer_reviews.text: Long time ASICS fan. I need the DuoMax for my over-pronation and particularly have liked the 2000s support. These newer 2000s are designed differently than previous models. Toe box is a bit snugger, but overall I like the feel and design. 10 1/2" was what I wear in 2000s and these seem to fit fine. Just started wearing for casual wear not running. Will update if I start to see premature wear or have any other issues.
customer_reviews.author: ManateeWithAHat

customer_reviews.title: Good work sneakers.
customer_reviews.text: Got these on recommendation for work due to back and hip issues since I'm on my feet all day. I was hesitant at first with how thin the soles are as I'm used to New Balance and $50 air monarchs. They truly do help. They're light and supportive. I would recommend that during the winter you wear a separate pair of boots or junky sneakers before switching into them to save on the wear and tear from water and salt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: PNW running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying and returning shoes for about a month looking for a decent pair that suits my needs. I need something that is water resistant since I live in the Pacific Northwest and puddles are a fact of life. I need a shoe with a higher than usual heel support and a wide toe box. This pair satisfied all of my requirements and they look pretty good. I have run twice in them (total of about 10 miles) on a mix of road, sidewalk, grass, & trail and they do not hurt my heel, nor do they irritate the sides of my foot which is a common issue.
customer_reviews.author: Flammable Bog Monster

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE SHOES. They go well with PT UNIFORM.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of the years. I normally purchase high visibility colors for safety. The hi-vis were more expensive. These shoes look nice with the ARMY PT Uniform. More importantly they feel good to run in. I typically run 2-8 miles at a time in them.
customer_reviews.author: #GorgeLife

customer_reviews.title: What I expect from the GT trail line from ASICS
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes. They look nicer than expertos and even wear them out on the town after I clean them up from the trail. Super comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Perceptual

customer_reviews.title: I'd Give it 5 Stars If It Breathed Better
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Asics for the way they disperse the energy at the heel making it easier on the joints--particularly the knees and back. My neighborhood is FLAT and either concrete or asphalt surfaces to take walk on. Asics make a difference. I do wish they breathed better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Great Looks while keeping comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable shoe that has a distinctive look and color not typical of other sneakers. Use it more as a casual walker. I use other models for athletic walking like the nimbus and cumulus. Love this style
customer_reviews.author: sprague smith

customer_reviews.title: Just not up to snuff for a trail shoe or an Asic
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable. bought as a second pair of shoes to leave at a friends house so i would always have trail shoes when flying there. Not comfy to run in. Materials felt cheap. Ended up only using these in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Kaotic1

customer_reviews.title: Sizing issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same shoe 2 years ago. I ordered a size 12 and had to return it for size 11.5. But the 11.5 is too tight in the toe box. Knowing that, I'm keeping the size 12 this time even though it is too large.
customer_reviews.author: D. Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Bought because I have flat feet. Love them
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 2 other pairs of acsis and they both wore out in 1 year but I’ll happily pay $70/year for the 0 pain I get from acsis shoes. I would walk in these suckers all day and my feet would be fine at the end of the day. Nike shoes? Ha I need to get rid of them in 30mins or I’m gonna cry.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to shoes for running and working out. The GT 2000 are great shoes. Wished the toe box of newer GT 2000's were reinforced like older models. Have problems with material tearing.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie H

customer_reviews.title: Good in the dirt, not as supportive as Gel Kayano
customer_reviews.text: I picked up these shoes as an alternative to my Gel Kayano running shoes, specifically for rainy days or running through mud. If you are an overpronator, these will be ok for shorter distances but I would say they do not provide enough support for a longer run. My calves started to fatigue earlier than with my normal shoes. Still like them for bootcamp workouts in the mud.
customer_reviews.author: Return of the Mac

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again...
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had more colors to choose from is only issue...
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Kegelman

customer_reviews.title: Flat feet fixers
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet, and these are made with the supirior arch support I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The lace binding will drive you crazy
customer_reviews.text: The loop that binds to the interior of the shoe is not properly glued. The loop has a sharp edge and will eventually cut into the side of your foot. It can be mitigated, but frustrating if you are far from home without scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe! Holds the heel very well and has a good sole. Great color also. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for trail running imho
customer_reviews.text: I love the shoes. But I think they are not meant for heavy duty trail running. After one day of wearing some spools formed on the heels. Still 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: best shoe
customer_reviews.text: this is the only shoe that dosent hurt my feet when running
customer_reviews.author: gerald casperson

customer_reviews.title: What happened to Asics?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Worst pair of Asics I've owned in 15 years! They fit perfect and feel perfect but fell apart in less than 3 weeks!!!!! Waste of over 100 bucks! Amazon refunded the money but still feel the same about the shoe Amazon itself gets 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable workout show that I own. True to size. Perfect!! ...and love the color
customer_reviews.author: DANNY PUTNAM

customer_reviews.title: exceedingly narrow design
customer_reviews.text: I had Asics shoes before, but this one was even more narrow than anyone I had before. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Giesche

customer_reviews.title: Asics 2000
customer_reviews.text: For me, I never have to try on Asics, just order size 10 and ready to run when they arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Close, very close
customer_reviews.text: Have bought the same shoe for years but seems sizing or perhaps my foot has changed
customer_reviews.author: michael l leffman

customer_reviews.title: This shoe messed up my feet
customer_reviews.text: My feet have been hurting since I brought the shoe even after I quit wearing shoe. I have been buying Asics for years
customer_reviews.author: mike ormond

customer_reviews.title: All good.
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted. I already knew the size. All good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: what's not to like. I put lots of miles on these
customer_reviews.text: It's Asics classic trainer in the color of a classic guitar; what's not to like. I put lots of miles on these.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Good looking too
customer_reviews.text: Always have bought the gt-2000 line and these shoes are consistent with all the others. Lightweight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Branson

product_meta.title: Asics Mens Gt-2000 6 Trail Shoes
product_meta.description: The running icon gets the trail treatment to create a hybrid shoe that seamlessly transitions from on-road to off-road. Get the high-mileage durability that the GT-2000 is known for plus a rugged lug outsole for extra traction on dirt paths. The DuoMax support system and heel-to-toe GEL cushioning offer protective stability that absorbs shock on any surface. Weight: 11.1. Heel Height: 22. Forefoot Height: 12.
feature_bullets: FlyteFoam Midsole Technology - Our FlyteFoam technology provides exceptional bounce back and responsiveness no matter the distance, utilizing organic super fibers to help reduce packing out that traditionally happens with softer, low density foams.
Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Technology Cushioning System - Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
Guidance Trusstic System Technology - This Trusstic System Technology integrates Guidance Line construction for enhanced gait efficiency while providing midfoot structural integrity.
Guidance Line Midsole Technology - Vertical flex groove decouples the tooling along the line of progression for enhanced gait efficiency.
AHAR Outsole - Acronym for ASICS High Abrasion Rubber. Placed in critical areas of the outsole for exceptional durability.
